CatDescriptText: Benjamin Lewis, unemployed, 92 Roberts Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1959, pg. 32, with question: "Do you believe in capital punishment? If so, do you think that it should be imposed on convicted defendants under the age of 21?"  Answer reads: "No.  I do not believe in capital punishment.  And the reason is my religion.  I'm a members of the Church of God in Christ.  I believe that a person should be tried and sentenced for brutal crimes, if convicted, but the death penalty should not be inflicted.  In my opinion, it is all right for a person to be sentenced to life in prison.  And, in that way he will pay many times for his crime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Benjamin Lewis wearing cap and leather coat, standing in front of brick wall with stone railing
